subject: integrating junit with jprobe
msgSnippet: Hello everybody, I have been trying to integrate JUNIT and JProbe using ant scripts. I am getting a JProbe coverage report. However, no matter what testcases I
messageBody:
Hello everybody,

I have been trying to integrate JUNIT and JProbe using ant scripts. I
am getting a JProbe coverage report. However, no matter what testcases
I specify, I seem to be getting the same coverage results. I tried
looking at the docs of jprobe, but couldn't figure out as to where i
went wrong.

here is a snippet of my code:
<!-- Runs Student.java -->
<target name="run" description="Run Student.java">
<java classname="edu.xyz.studentBill.Student" fork="yes">
<classpath>
<pathelement
location="${local.classes.path}/studentBill.jar"/>
<pathelement path="${local.classes.path}"/>
</classpath>
</java>
</target>

<!-- targets used by run-test target -->
<target name="run-test.init.notinstrumented" unless="jprobe"
description="Initialize properties needed to execute
run-test without instrumentation">
<property name="run-test.jvm" value="java"/>
<property name="run-test.jvmarg" value="-showversion"/>
</target>

<target name="check.exist.jpl" description="Initialize exist.jpl">
<available property="exist.jpl" type="file"
file="${local.root}/jpl/StudentBill-coverage.jpl"/>
</target>

<!-- If jpl/studentBill-coverage.jpl does not exist, creates it
on-the-fly. The jpl created will have
4 triggers which turn two existing junit tests into JProbe Use
Cases. -->
<target name="run-test.init.instrumented.createjpl"
depends="check.exist.jpl" unless="exist.jpl"
description="Creates a jpl to run Student class in Coverage
on-the-fly if jpl/studentBill-coverage.jpl does not exist">
<mkdir dir="${local.root}/jpl"/>
<coverage home="${jprobe.home}"
java="${jprobe.java}"
ignoreabstract="true"
granularity="line"
usecase="none"
exportjpl="${local.root}/jpl/studentBill-coverage.jpl">
<messages>
<message category="system" target="default"/>
</messages>
<collectdata> <!-- collect data is only on source files-->
<include expression="edu.xyz.studentBill.*.*()"/>

</collectdata>
<classpath>
<!-- <pathelement path="${local.classes.path}"/>-->
<pathelement location
="${local.classes.path}/studentBill.jar"/>
<pathelement
location="${local.ResultFormatter.path}/ResultFormatter.jar"/>
<path refid="lib.path"/>
<pathelement path="${local.junittests.root}/classes"/>
</classpath>
<application classname="edu.xyz.studentBill.Student"/>
<triggers>
<trigger
method="edu.xyz.studentBill.testcases.TestStudentBill.testGradFee()"
event="entry" executeon="1"
frequency="1" totalexecutions="1"
action="start_use_case"/>
<trigger
method="edu.xyz.studentBill.testcases.TestStudentBill.testGradFee()"
event="exit" executeon="1"
frequency="1" totalexecutions="1"
action="finish_use_case"/>
<trigger
method="edu.xyz.studentBill.testcases.TestStudentBill.testUndergradFee()"
event="entry" executeon="1"
frequency="1" totalexecutions="1"
action="start_use_case"/>
<trigger
method="edu.xyz.studentBill.testcases.TestStudentBill.testUndergradFee()"
event="exit" executeon="1"
frequency="1" totalexecutions="1"
action="finish_use_case"/>
<trigger
method="edu.xyz.studentBill.testcases.TestStudentBill.tesGradFee()"
event="exit" executeon="1"
frequency="1" totalexecutions="1"
action="finish_use_case"/>
<trigger
method="edu.xyz.studentBill.testcases.TestStudentBill.testGradFee()"
event="exit" executeon="1"
frequency="1" totalexecutions="1"
action="finish_use_case"/>
<trigger
method="edu.xyz.studentBill.testcases.TestStudentBill.testInvalidInputCreditsEnrolled()"
event="exit" executeon="1"
frequency="1" totalexecutions="1"
action="finish_use_case"/>
<trigger
method="edu.xyz.studentBill.testcases.TestStudentBill.testInvalidInputCreditsEnrolled()"
event="exit" executeon="1"
frequency="1" totalexecutions="1"
action="finish_use_case"/>
</triggers>
</coverage>
</target>

<!-- Used by the "run-test" target to initialize properties
needed to execute the "run-test" target -->
<target name="run-test.init.instrumented" if="jprobe"
description="Initialize properties needed to execute run-test
with instrumentation">
<!-- To run Student Class in Coverage, a jpl file is needed.
Create this jpl if necessary. -->
<antcall target="run-test.init.instrumented.createjpl"/>

<!-- To run Student,Bill Classes in Coverage, jplauncher
rather than java should be used. -->
<property name="run-test.jvm"
value="${jprobe.home}/bin/jplauncher"/>
<property name="run-test.jvmarg"
value="-jp_input=${local.root}/jpl/studentBill-coverage.jpl"/>
</target>


<!-- Initialize exist.snapshots property depending on whether or
not snapshots/studentBill_1.jpc exists. -->
<target name="check.exist.snapshots" description="Initialize
exist.snapshots">
<available property="exist.snapshots" type="file"
file="${local.root}/snapshots/studentBill_1.jpc"/>
</target>

<!-- Create snapshots in "snapshots" folder if
snapshots/studentBill_1.jpc does not exist. -->
<target name="create.snapshots" depends="check.exist.snapshots"
unless="exist.snapshots"
description="Create snapshots that can be used for executing
jpcovmerge and jpcovreport">
<!-- Call coverage to create snapshots that can be used for
merging or as input to jpcovreport -->
<antcall target="coverage"/>
</target>

<!-- JProbe ANT Tasks -->
<taskdef name="jpcovbaseline"
classname="com.jprobe.ant.JPCovBaseline" classpath="${jprobe.ant.jar}"/>
<taskdef name="jpcovmerge" classname="com.jprobe.ant.JPCovMerge"
classpath="${jprobe.ant.jar}"/>
<taskdef name="jpcovreport" classname="com.jprobe.ant.JPCovReport"
classpath="${jprobe.ant.jar}"/>
<taskdef name="coverage" classname="com.jprobe.ant.Coverage"
classpath="${jprobe.ant.jar}"/>

<!-- Executes studentBill in JProbe Coverage. The triggers will
create a snapshot in the default snapshot
folder everytime the game logic is executed. -->
<target name="coverage" description="Execute Student in JProbe
Coverage">
<!-- Creates snapshots folder -->
<mkdir dir="${local.root}/snapshots" />
<coverage home="${jprobe.home}"
java="${jprobe.java}"
ignoreabstract="true"
granularity="line"
usecase="none"
snapshotdir="${local.root}/snapshots">
<messages>
<message category="system" target="default"/>
</messages>
<collectdata>
<include expression="edu.xyz.studentBill.Bill.*()"/>
</collectdata>
<classpath>
<pathelement
location="${local.classes.path}/studentBill.jar"/>
</classpath>
<application classname="edu.xyz.studentBill.Student" />
<triggers>
<!-- <trigger
method="edu.xyz.studentBill.Student.Student()" event="entry"
executeon="1" frequency="1" action="start_use_case"/>
<trigger
method="edu.xyz.studentBill.Student.displayStudentInfo()" event="exit"
executeon="1" frequency="1" totalexecutions="all"
action="finish_use_case" outputfile="studentBill"/> -->
<trigger
method="edu.xyz.studentBill.Bill.computeFee()" event="entry"
executeon="1" frequency="1" action="start_use_case"/>
<trigger
method="edu.xyz.studentBill.Bill.computeFee()" event="exit"
executeon="1" frequency="1" totalexecutions="all"
action="finish_use_case" outputfile="studentBill"/>
</triggers>
</coverage>
</target>



<target name="run-test" depends="run-test.init.notinstrumented,
run-test.init.instrumented" description="Testing all source files
using junit">
<property environment="env"/>
<junit printsummary="yes" fork="yes"
haltonfailure="false" jvm="${run-test.jvm}">
<jvmarg value="${run-test.jvmarg}"/>
<!--base directory to locate where the tests are found-->
<sysproperty key="basedir" value="${local.root}">
</sysproperty>

<classpath>
<pathelement
path="${local.ResultFormatter.path}/ResultFormatter.jar"/>
<path location="${local.classes.path}"/>
<pathelement path="${junit.root}/junit.jar"/>
<path refid="ant.lib"/>
<path location="${local.junittests.root}/classes"/>
</classpath>

<!-- Using customized XMLJUnitResultFormatter.java file-->
<formatter usefile="true"

classname="com.fatwire.junitframework.ResultFormatter"
extension=".xml"/>

<!-- using normal junit -->
<!-- <formatter type="xml"/> -->

<batchtest fork="yes" todir="${local.reports.path}">
<fileset dir="${local.junittests.root}/classes">
<include name="**/*.*"/>
</fileset>
</batchtest>
</junit>

</target>

<target name="jpcovbaseline">
<jpcovbaseline home="${jprobe.home}"
granularity="line"
ignoreabstract="true"
programname="edu.xyz.studentBill.Student"
overwriteoutput="true"
verbose="false"
destfile="${local.root}/snapshots/baseline.jpc">
<refclasspath position="append">
<pathelement
location="${local.classes.path}/studentBill.jar"/>
</refclasspath>
<collectdata>
<include expression="edu.xyz.studentBill.*.*()"/>
</collectdata>
</jpcovbaseline>
</target>

<target name="jpcovmerge">
<jpcovmerge home="${jprobe.home}"
input="${local.root}/jpl/StudentBill-coverage.jpl"
verbose="true"
overwriteoutput="true"
destfile="${local.root}/snapshots/mergedresults.jpc">
<fileset dir="${local.root}/snapshots">
<include name="*.jpc"/>
</fileset>
</jpcovmerge>
</target>

<!-- Executes jpcovreport on the snapshot:
snapshots/studentBill_1.jpc. If this snapshot does not exists,
creates it on-the-fly by executing the "coverage" target. -->
<target name="jpcovreport"
description="Execute JProbe jpcovreport command line utility">
<jpcovreport home="${jprobe.home}"
format="html"
type="verydetailed"
hitmissed="missed"
filtercatchblocks="true"
sourcecode="true"
snapshot="${local.root}/snapshots/mergedresults.jpc"
destfile="${local.reports.path}/jpcoverage-report">
<displaydata>
<include expression="edu.xyz.studentBill.*.*()"/>
</displaydata>
<sourcepath>
<pathelement path="${local.srcFiles.path}"/>
</sourcepath>
</jpcovreport>
</target>
